column2: # I want to try and constrain the data itself before I put it into the map making
# functions so that I can see if that gives me a more detailed fill
# or perhaps there just isn't enough? but then each would be red idk I think I can get it

The following objects are masked from detDat (pos = 3):

    address, arrest_charge, block_id, charge_description, council_district, crime_id, day_of_week, hour_of_day, ibr_date, incident_time,
    incident_timestamp, latitude, longitude, neighborhood, offense_category, offense_description, oid, precinct, report_number,
    scout_car_area, state_offense_code, X, Y, year, zip_code

The following objects are masked from detDat (pos = 4):

    address, arrest_charge, block_id, charge_description, council_district, crime_id, day_of_week, hour_of_day, ibr_date, incident_time,
    incident_timestamp, latitude, longitude, neighborhood, offense_category, offense_description, oid, precinct, report_number,
    scout_car_area, state_offense_code, X, Y, year, zip_code
map_bounds <- c(left = min_x + offset + .01, bottom = min_y + offset, right = max_x - offset - .01, top = max_y - offset - .01)
coords.map <- coords.map + stat_density2d(data=coords.data,  aes(x=longitude, y=latitude, fill=..level.., alpha=alph_lev), geom="polygon")
